name: Clin T Heart Mediastinum
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  For TNM staging, sarcomas of the heart and mediastinum are classified as deep tumors.

**Note 2:** For T, assign the appropriate category based on the tumor size.

    Invasive tumor confined to site of origin
    Adjacent connective tissue:
        For heart: 
            Visceral pericardium (epicardium)
    Adjacent organs/structures:
        For Heart: 
            Ascending aorta
            Parietal pericardium
            Vena cava
        For mediastinum: 
            Descending aorta
            Esophagus
            Large (named) artery(ies)
            Large (named) vein(s)
            Pericardium, NOS
               Parietal
               Visceral (epicardium)
            Phrenic nerve(s)
            Pleura, NOS
            Parietal pleura
            Visceral pleura of lung
        Sternum
        Sympathetic nerve trunk(s)
        Thoracic duct
        Thymus
        Trachea, parietal pleura
        Vertebra(e)

Further contiguous extension

Localized, NOS
rows:
Clinical evaluation performed but unknown results or extension not stated
Clinical evaluation performed but results not documented in patient record
Size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary site
Tumor 5 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 5 cm in greatest dimension

Clinical T is not defined for the specific site/histology
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No clinical evaluation of primary tumor
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
Unknown if any clinical assessment performed
